Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI

Class Gui

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.Gui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserInterface
    public class Gui
extends javafx.application.Application
implements UserInterface
    is the base of the gui, between the various stages change and similar

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean bb  
      static float DEFAULT_MIN_HEIGHT
      default min height of the start, reconnect, lobby and end scenes
      static float DEFAULT_MIN_HEIGHT_MAP
      default min height of the main game scene
      static float DEFAULT_MIN_WIDTH
      default min widht of the start, reconnect, lobby and end scenes
      static float DEFAULT_MIN_WIDTH_MAP
      default min widht of the main game scene
      private static java.lang.String FX_PATH  
      private static GuiController guiController
      Reference to the controller of the login scene
      private static GuiEndController guiEndController
      Reference to the controller of the game end scene
      private static GuiLobbyController guiLobbyController
      Reference to the controller of the lobby scene
      private static GuiMapController guiMapController
      Reference to the controller of the main game scene
      private static GuiReconnectionController guiReconnectionController
      Reference to the controller of the reconnection scene
      private static GuiStartController guiStartController
      Reference to the controller of the first scene
      private boolean isReconnection
      True if it is a reconnection, false if it is a normal game login from the beginning It will be set to false when gameStart is called, which is being called only at the beginning of the match so reconnection will have this boolean to true, to manage some specific GUI case in which you need to ignore first updates after reconnection
      private boolean receivedReconnectOk
      After the GUI receives reconnectok, it means that it can start to handle again stats updates instead of skipping them, need this only after reconnections
      private int validMove
      used to ask the server if the specified direction is valid (= no walls), since the cacheModel version doesn't store the cell adjacences we need to ask the server if a direction is valid or not
      private static View view
      reference to the view linked to this UserInterface
      private java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> wasOnline
      used to store a previous version of online status, to check if user is reconnecting or the stats updates are the same as before

      • Fields inherited from class javafx.application.Application

        STYLESHEET_CASPIAN, STYLESHEET_MODENA

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void askGrenade()
      When a user takes damage from another player, it will be asked if he wants to use this powerUp
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> askMapAndSkulls()
      Ask mapType and number of skulls to place in the killshotTrack (only to the first player connected)
      void close()
      Close the UserInterface, after a timer of the current action phase expires
      void doFrenzyAtomicShoot()
      This method will ask the player to redo just the shoot part of the FrenzyShoot
      void doFrenzyReload()
      This method will ask the player to do the reload atomic action for the frenzy shoot
      void endGame()
      This method will show the end game screen

      StartAction method, in which the user can choose between the game actions: move, move grab, shoot
      void startGame()
      Start the game in the selected user interface
      void startPowerUp()
      Handles the user powerUp phase, in which it let the user choose if he wants to use a PowerUp or skip this phase
      void startReload()
      Last turn phase, in which the user is asked if he wants to reload one or more of his weapons
      void startSpawn()
      Handles the user spawn, asking for a powerUp to discard and forwarding it to the view linked to this UI
      void startUI()
      This function starts the ui and ask the user which protocol wants to use

      • guiEndController

      • validMove

        private int validMove
        used to ask the server if the specified direction is valid (= no walls), since the cacheModel version doesn't store the cell adjacences we need to ask the server if a direction is valid or not

      • isReconnection

        private boolean isReconnection
        True if it is a reconnection, false if it is a normal game login from the beginning It will be set to false when gameStart is called, which is being called only at the beginning of the match so reconnection will have this boolean to true, to manage some specific GUI case in which you need to ignore first updates after reconnection

      • receivedReconnectOk

        private boolean receivedReconnectOk
        After the GUI receives reconnectok, it means that it can start to handle again stats updates instead of skipping them, need this only after reconnections

      • wasOnline

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> wasOnline
        used to store a previous version of online status, to check if user is reconnecting or the stats updates are the same as before

      • bb

        private boolean bb

      • view

        private static View view
        reference to the view linked to this UserInterface

      • notifyUpdate

        public void notifyUpdate​(UpdateType updateType,
                         int playerId,
                         TurnUpdate turnUpdate)
        Notify that a local client class has been updated inside the cachemodel
        Specified by:
        notifyUpdate in interface UserInterface
        Parameters:
        updateType - the class which has been updated
        playerId - useful in some case to determine which player has been updated (i.e. new position)
        turnUpdate - is the update class if the update is of type Turn

      • retryLogin

        public void retryLogin​(java.lang.Exception e)
        Same as above, but with custom exceptions instead of String as error
        Specified by:
        retryLogin in interface UserInterface
        Parameters:
        e - custom exception to represent why login wasn't successful

      • startAction

        public void startAction​(boolean isFrenzy,
                        boolean isBeforeFrenzyStarter)
        StartAction method, in which the user can choose between the game actions: move, move grab, shoot
        Specified by:
        startAction in interface UserInterface
        Parameters:
        isFrenzy - if is set to true start Frenzy methods, otherwise normal actions
        isBeforeFrenzyStarter - if true: current player is before frenzy starter, otherwise false

      • doFrenzyAtomicShoot

        Specified by:

      • doFrenzyReload

        public void doFrenzyReload()

        Specified by:

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        This method will show the end game screen
        Specified by:
        endGame in interface UserInterface

      • setValidMove

        public void setValidMove​(boolean b)
        Method useful for movements. First the client calls askMoveValid, with a single direction, the the server reply back to the client throught this setter, and it sets validMove to true if the direction is valid (no walls, nor out of map), otherwise false
        Specified by:
        setValidMove in interface UserInterface
        Parameters:
        b - boolean, true if direction is valid, false otherwise

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the UserInterface, after a timer of the current action phase expires
        Specified by:
        close in interface UserInterface

      • askMapAndSkulls

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> askMapAndSkulls()
        Ask mapType and number of skulls to place in the killshotTrack (only to the first player connected)
        Specified by:
        askMapAndSkulls in interface UserInterface
        Returns:
        a list of 2 integers, the first one is the chosen mapType, the second one the chosen number of skulls

      • skullSelector

        private int skullSelector()
        select the number of skulls in this method
        Returns:
        the number chosen
